or sign in a stable and safe condition so as not to endanger any person or property upon any public
sidewalk, street or alley within the city. (1977 Code § 5.16.030)
4-7-4: ADVERTISING IN PUBLIC WAYS RESTRICTED:
No person, firm or corporation, excepting such as has first obtained a license under the provisions of
this chapter, shall post or paste within the city any bill, sign or placard advertising any circus, tent
show, vaudeville tent show, medicine show, carnival or other itinerant tent or open air show when, in
doing such posting or pasting, the person doing the same or any materials or implements used by him
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 116/460
in such posting or pasting shall stand in, remain on or occupy any part of any public street, alley or
sidewalk within the city. (1977 Code § 5.16.040)
4-7-5: PENALTY:
Any person who shall violate any provision of this chapter shall, upon conviction thereof, be subject to
a fine as provided in section 1-4-1 of this code. (2013 Code)
Chapter 8
MASSAGE ESTABLISHMENTS
4-8-1: STATE LICENSE REQUIRED:
No individual, partnership or firm, for monetary compensation, shall, within the city, engage in the
practice of body massage, manipulation or rubdown for purposes other than therapeutic without first
having obtained a license from the state of Illinois department of professional regulation as a physical
therapist, without having filed satisfactory evidence thereof with the city clerk and in compliance with
the state massage licensing act of 20031. (1977 Code § 9.16.010; amd. 2013 Code)
4-8-2: PROHIBITED PRACTICES:
No individual, partnership or firm, for monetary compensation, shall, within the city, engage in the
practice of body massage, manipulation or rubdown for purposes of sexual gratification of another.
(1977 Code § 9.16.020)
4-8-3: PENALTY:
Any person who shall violate any provision of this chapter shall, upon conviction thereof, be subject to
a fine as provided in section 1-4-1 of this code for each offense. (2013 Code)
Chapter 9
TATTOO AND BODY PIERCING ESTABLISHMENTS
4-9-1: SCOPE:
This chapter shall apply to all territory embraced within the limits of the city. (Ord. 1840, 3-25-2002)
4-9-2: DEFINITIONS:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 117/460
BODY PIERCER: One who punctures the skin and inserts a ring, hoop, stud or other object.
CITY: The city of Marion, Illinois.
CONSUMER: Any member of the public who is provided access to a tattoo or body piercing facility in
exchange for a fee or other compensation, or any individual who, in exchange for a fee or other
compensation, is afforded use of a tattoo or body piercing facility as a condition or benefit of
membership or access.
FEE: The amount charged to any individual for tattooing or body piercing.
INSPECTORS: All authorized agents of the city of Marion who have the authority to enter and make
reasonable inspections of any tattoo or body piercing parlor during their regular hours of business for
the purpose of determining compliance with this chapter. Inspectors may include not only employees
of city, but such other individuals and personnel of either public or private agencies which may, from
time to time, be engaged by the city for the purpose of this chapter.
OTHER COMPENSATION: The payment or exchange of goods, services, or anything of value for use
of the tattoo or body piercing parlor.
PIERCE: To make a hole in order to insert or allow the insertion of any ring, hoop, stud or other object
for ornamentation of the body.
TATTOO: A permanent design on the skin made by puncturing the skin and inserting indelible colors.
TATTOO FACILITY OR BODY PIERCING FACILITY: Any place where the act of tattooing or body
piercing is performed regardless of whether a fee is involved.
TATTOOER: One who punctures the skin and inserts indelible colors to form a tattoo.
TATTOOING: The act of puncturing the skin and inserting indelible colors to form a permanent design.
(Ord. 1840, 3-25-2002; amd. 2013 Code)
4-9-3: PERMIT REQUIREMENTS:
A. Permit And Compliance Required: It shall be unlawful for any person to tattoo or body pierce
persons within the city who does not possess a valid permit issued by the city. Only a person who
complies with the requirements of this chapter shall be entitled to receive and retain such a permit.
B. Application For Permit: Any person desiring to tattoo or body pierce shall make written application
for a permit on the form provided by the city clerk at least one week prior to the proposed date of
opening, or in the event of persons currently engaged in such activities, within one week from the
effective date hereof, on forms provided by the city. Such application shall be completed and
signed by the owner or his or her representative.
C. Permit Fee: The annual fee for a tattoo or body piercing permit shall be five hundred dollars
($500.00). Such fee shall be payable upon receipt of an invoice issued by the city.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 118/460
D. Inspections; Issuance Of Permit: Upon receipt of such application, the city shall inspect the
establishment named in the application prior to the date of opening, and the city shall determine if
the establishment is in compliance with the provisions of this chapter. When an inspection reveals
that the provisions of this chapter have been met, a permit shall be issued.
E. Term Of Permit: The permit is valid for a period of twelve (12) months from the date of issuance.
F. Posting Permit: The permit shall be prominently posted in public view.
G. Suspension Of Permit:
1. Grounds: Permits may be suspended temporarily by the city for failure of the holder to comply
with the requirements of this chapter. (Ord. 1840, 3-25-2002)
2. Notice Of Suspension; Appeal: Whenever a permit holder or operator has failed to comply with
any notice issued under the provision of subsection 4-9-12E of this chapter, the permit holder or
operator shall be notified in writing that the permit is, upon service of the notice, suspended and
that an opportunity for a hearing will be provided if, within seventy two (72) hours, a written
request for a hearing is filed with the city by the permit holder. (Ord. 1840, 3-25-2002; amd. Ord.
2127, 2-12-2007)
3. Summary Suspension; Appeal: Notwithstanding the other provisions of this chapter, whenever
the city finds unsanitary or other conditions in the tattoo operation which, in its judgment,
constitute a substantial immediate hazard to the public health, it may, without warning, notice or
hearing, issue a written notice to the permit holder or operator citing such condition, specifying
the corrective action to be taken, and specifying the time period within which such action shall be
taken; and if deemed necessary, such other shall state that the permit is suspended at the time
of inspection. Tattoo service operations are to be immediately discontinued. Any person to whom
such an order is issued shall comply therewith but, upon written petition, filed not more than
seventy two (72) hours after the discontinuance order, may request a hearing for abatement of
the order. The city shall provide a hearing not later than five (5) days from the filing of said
petition.
4. Reinstatement Of Suspended Permit: Any person whose permit has been suspended may, at
any time, make application for a reinspection for the purpose of reinstatement of the permit.
Within five (5) days following receipt of a written request, including a statement signed by the
applicant that, in his opinion, the conditions causing suspension of the permit have been
corrected, the city shall make a reinspection. If the applicant is in compliance with the
requirements of this chapter, the permit shall be reinstated.
H. Revocation Of Permit; Appeal: For serious and/or repeated violations of any of the requirements of
this chapter, or for the interference with the city or its designees in the performance of its duties,
the permit may be permanently revoked after an opportunity for a hearing has been provided. Prior
to such hearing, the city shall notify the permit holder in writing, stating the reasons for which the
permit is subject to revocation, and advising that the permit shall be permanently revoked at the
end of five (5) days following service of such notice unless, within such five (5) day period, a
written petition for a hearing is filed with the city. A hearing shall be provided no later than five (5)
days from the filing of said petition. A permit may be suspended for cause pending its revocation or
a hearing relative thereto. (Ord. 1840, 3-25-2002)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 119/460
4-9-4: SANITARY FACILITIES:
A. Potable Water: The potable water supply must be constructed and operated in accordance with the
law.
B. Sewage Disposal: All water carried waste shall be disposed of by discharging into a sewerage
system operated and maintained under permit of the Illinois environmental protection agency
(IEPA) or a private sewage system constructed in accordance with the Illinois private sewage
disposal licensing act and code.
C. Solid Waste Disposal:
1. Containers:
a. All solid waste shall be kept in durable containers that do not leak or absorb liquids. Infectious
waste biohazard bags shall be used to line containers used for materials that have come into
contact with body fluids.
b. Containers shall be stored inside the establishment and shall be provided with tightfitting lids
and kept covered when not in use.
2. Disposal: All garbage and rubbish shall be disposed of at least once a week to an IEPA
regulated landfill or incinerator.
D. Sharps: Used needles, lancets and other sharp items must be placed in puncture resistant
containers located in the use area. The puncture resistant containers shall be disposed of by a
licensed IEPA medical waste disposal company. (Ord. 1840, 3-25-2002)
4-9-5: PREMISES REQUIREMENTS:
A. All parts of the premises of a tattoo or body piercing facility shall be kept in a clean, sanitary and
orderly condition at all times.
B. There shall be a hand washing facility located within the tattooing or body piercing area. This hand
washing facility shall be provided with hot and cold running water and be separate from any public
restroom. A supply of bactericidal hand cleansing soap or detergent must be available. A supply of
disposable sanitary towels or a heated air hand drying device must be provided at the hand wash
sink. If disposable towels are used, easily cleanable waste receptacles must be conveniently
located near the hand washing facility. Hand wash sinks shall be accessible to employees at all
times. (Ord. 1840, 3-25-2002)
4-9-6: EQUIPMENT REQUIREMENTS:
A. Needles, lancets, other sharp objects, pens, stencils, ink caps and their contents shall be disposed
of after puncturing the skin and/or contact with body fluids and prior to the tattooer's or body
piercer's removal of gloves.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 120/460
B. All other equipment used in the application of the tattoo shall be washed, rinsed, sterilized and air
dried after each use. The method of sterilization shall be in a manner described as follows: (Ord.
1840, 3-25-2002)
1. a. Autoclave at two hundred seventy degrees Fahrenheit (270°F) under twenty (20) pounds of
pressure for thirty (30) minutes.
b. Needles, tubes and bars shall remain in their sterilization packages until used.
c. The above mentioned method is approved by the city for proper sterilization of tattooing or
body piercing equipment.
2. Autoclave shall be spore tested once a month and a written record maintained of the date of
such testing. (Ord. 1845, 4-15-2002)
C. Solder used as a part of the equipment must be lead free.
D. All equipment and preparation materials used in the application of the tattoo or body piercing shall
be stored in such a manner as to prevent accidental contaminations.
E. All tables or counters shall be constructed of a nonabsorbent, smooth, easily cleanable, durable
material which is capable of being sanitized.
F. Clean, dry and disposable sanitary toweling shall be provided and used for no other purpose than
with the tattooing process. Towels and sheets shall be discarded or cleaned after each use. (No
repeat use between clients.)
G. Floors, walls and ceilings shall be constructed of a smooth, easily cleanable, durable material.
Concrete or pumice blocks used for interior wall construction shall be finished and sealed to
provide an easily cleanable surface.
H. Kneeling pads, other pads, and contact surfaces such as, but not limited to, machine heads and
clipboards, shall be cleaned and sanitized after each use. Such contact surfaces shall be sanitized
by rinsing, spraying, or swabbing with a chemical sanitizing solution that will provide the equivalent
bactericidal effect of a solution containing at least one hundred (100) parts per million of available
chlorine as a hypochlorite and having a temperature of at least seventy five degrees Fahrenheit
(75°F).
I. A test kit or other device that accurately measures the parts per million concentration of the
sanitizing solution shall be available and used after each mixing of a new batch. (Ord. 1840, 3-25-
2002)
4-9-7: BODY FLUID PRECAUTIONS:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 121/460
A. Hands shall be properly washed before and after contact with clients. Hands must be washed
before and after gloves are used. If hands come in contact with blood, body fluids or human tissue,
they must be immediately washed with bactericidal soap and water.
B. Surgical gloves must be worn when contact with blood, body fluids, tissue or contaminated surfaces
is anticipated.
C. Gowns and/or aprons must be worn when providing services for clients if clothing is likely to be
soiled with blood or body fluids.
D. Protective eyewear should be worn when services are being provided for the customer. Employees
of the tattooer or body piercer are required to wear protective eyewear while tattooing or body
piercing. (Ord. 1840, 3-25-2002)
4-9-8: PREPARATION OF SKIN AND AFTER CARE:
A. All materials used in the application of the tattoo are to be provided in sufficient quantities as to
preclude the need for replenishment during the actual tattooing. In the event that supplies do run
out during the tattooing, the tattooer is to either have an assistant, after proper hand washing,
deliver the needed items, or the tattooer must remove his gloves, properly wash his hands,
replenish supplies, properly wash his hands and put on new, unused surgical grade gloves.
B. The skin surface to be tattooed shall be shaved clean by a razor.
C. The skin surface to be tattooed shall be thoroughly washed for at least one minute with a
bactericidal soap.
D. During the tattooing, any oils, creams, gels, stencils, etc., used must be dispensed in a sanitary
manner. These items must be discarded after each tattoo.
E. Following the application of the tattoo, the area of the skin having the tattoo shall be properly
covered.
F. Before leaving the tattoo parlor or facility, each client shall receive printed tattoo care instructions
approved by the city. (Ord. 1840, 3-25-2002)
4-9-9: DISEASES REPORTED:
All communicable diseases resulting from a tattoo or body piercing shall be reported to the city by the
facility operator and the person having received the tattoo or body piercing. This shall be done
immediately upon detection of a disease or complication. (Ord. 1840, 3-25-2002)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 122/460
4-9-10: MINORS:
A. The tattooing of any person under the age of twenty one (21) by any person, other than a person
licensed to practice medicine in all of its branches, is prohibited.
B. No person shall pierce the body of a person under eighteen (18) years of age without the presence
of a parent or legal guardian, whose relation to the person under eighteen (18) years of age shall
be documented, and who gives written consent.
C. The information in subsections A and B of this section is to be posted next to the facility permits.
Failure to do so may result in suspension of the permit. (Ord. 1840, 3-25-2002)
4-9-11: RECORDS KEPT:
A file with the date of the procedure, tattooer's or body piercer's name, type of tattoo or body piercing,
and client's name, age, address and phone number shall be kept for a minimum of three (3) years and
made available for the city upon inspection of the facility. The client's age is to be documented by a
picture ID, which includes the client's date of birth. (Ord. 1840, 3-25-2002)
4-9-12: INSPECTIONS:
A. Inspections: Each establishment or facility in which tattooing or body piercing is conducted within
the city shall be inspected at least quarterly. As many additional inspections or reinspections as are
necessary for the enforcement of this chapter shall be made.
B. Report Required: The inspector shall prepare a written report of said inspection. Such report shall
be signed by the inspector and by the tattoo or body piercing facility owner or other designated
representative. A copy of such inspection report shall be left with the owner or manager.
C. Right Of Entry: The city, or its designee after proper identification, shall be permitted to inspect, at
any reasonable time, any tattooing or body piercing facility within the city, or its police jurisdiction,
for the purpose of determining compliance with this chapter. They shall be permitted to examine
records of the tattooer or body piercer to obtain information pertaining to supplies purchased,
received or used in the act of tattooing or body piercing and persons employed by the tattooer or
body piercer.
D. Record And Copy Of Inspections: Whenever an inspection of a tattooing or body piercing facility is
made, a record of findings will be made.
E. Notice Of Violation: Whenever it is discovered by an inspection of a tattooing or body piercing
facility that any of the provisions of this chapter have been violated, the permit holder or operator
will be notified of such violations by means of an inspection report form or written notice. In such
notifications, a specific and reasonable period of time for the correction of the violation found will
be noted. (Ord. 1840, 3-25-2002; amd. 2013 Code)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 123/460
4-9-13: EXCLUSIONS FROM PROVISIONS:
The provisions of this chapter may not be construed in any way to prohibit any injection, incision,
acupuncture or similar medical or dental procedure performed by a licensed healthcare professional or
other person authorized to perform that procedure, nor is anyone engaged solely in ear piercing
subject to the provisions of this chapter. (Ord. 1840, 3-25-2002; amd. Ord. 1845, 4-15-2002)
4-9-14: PENALTIES:
A. Any person engaged in tattooing or body piercing without a permit as provided herein shall be
subject to a fine as provided in section 1-4-1 of this code.
B. Any person who has been issued a permit as provided in this chapter whose conduct warrants
suspension or revocation of the permit by the provisions of this chapter shall be, in addition to such
suspension or revocation, subject to a fine as provided in section 1-4-1 of this code. (Ord. 1840, 3-
25-2002; amd. 2013 Code)
Chapter 10
TAXICABS
4-10-1: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this chapter, the following words and terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them in
this section:
PERSON: When referring to the owner or operator of any taxicab, means and includes any person,
firm, association or corporation.
TAXICAB: Includes all motor vehicles carrying passengers for hire for which public patronage is
solicited, provided motor buses or other vehicles operating under the authority of the Illinois commerce
commission or the interstate commerce commission shall not be considered taxicabs within the
meaning hereof. (Ord. 2374, 8-22-2011)
4-10-2: LICENSE REQUIRED:
A. It is unlawful for any person to operate or permit to be operated any taxicab in the city unless a
license has been issued by the city clerk for the operation of said taxicab and the license is in full
force and effect during the entire time the taxicab is in operation.
B. No license to operate a taxicab shall be issued except for a specific motor vehicle to be used for the
transportation of passengers for hire. (Ord. 2374, 8-22-2011)
4-10-3: INSURANCE REQUIRED:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 124/460
No license to operate a taxicab in the city shall be issued unless a certificate of insurance for liability
insurance on the specific vehicle in the amount of three hundred thousand dollars ($300,000.00) is in
full force and effect and has been filed with the city clerk; such insurance to be in force during the time
such vehicle is operated as a taxicab. (Ord. 2374, 8-22-2011; amd. Ord. 2381, 9-26-2011)
4-10-4: LICENSE FEE:
An annual license fee of fifty dollars ($50.00), payable to the city clerk, shall be charged at the time of
the application for a license for each taxicab. (Ord. 2374, 8-22-2011; amd. Ord. 2381, 9-26-2011)
4-10-5: CLASSIFICATION OF AND REQUIREMENTS FOR LICENSES:
A. Taxicab licenses issued prior to the effective date hereof are designated hereby as class I licenses.
Taxicab licenses issued after the effective date hereof are hereby designated class II licenses.
B. All class I taxicab licenses shall expire June 30, 2012. No class I license will be renewed.
C. The number of class II licenses authorized to be issued annually shall be sixteen (16), commencing
with the effective date hereof. No class II license shall be issued except for a specific motor vehicle
to be in service. (Ord. 2374, 8-22-2011)
4-10-6: EXPIRATION AND TERM OF LICENSES:
Taxicab licenses issued after the effective date hereof shall expire June 30, 2012. Thereafter, class II
licenses shall be issued effective July 1 and expire the following June 30. (Ord. 2374, 8-22-2011)
4-10-7: OPERATORS:
No person licensed to operate a taxicab in the city shall employ or allow anyone to operate such
taxicab who has been convicted of a felony or has been convicted of one or more violations of city
ordinances or laws of the state of Illinois relating to the operation of motor vehicles. (Ord. 2374, 10-24-
2011)
4-10-8: NUMBER OF PASSENGERS:
The number of passengers, exclusive of the driver, carried or conveyed in a taxicab licensed
hereunder shall not at any time exceed five (5). (Ord. 2374, 8-22-2011)
4-10-9: VEHICLE REQUIREMENTS:
The motor vehicles for which taxicab licenses are issued shall be maintained in a safe, clean,
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 125/460
operable condition at all times. Noncompliance with this section may result in revocation of the taxicab
license. (Ord. 2374, 8-22-2011)
4-10-10: REGISTER KEPT:
The city clerk shall keep a register showing the name and address of each person to whom a license
for a taxicab has been issued under this chapter, together with the license number, the description and
make of the taxicab, and the name and address of the insurance company provided in section 4-10-3
of this chapter. Such register shall be a matter of public record and open to inspection by the public at
reasonable times. (Ord. 2374, 8-22-2011)
4-10-11: REVOCATION OF LICENSE:
The mayor may revoke the license or licenses to operate a taxicab issued pursuant to the provisions
of this chapter whenever it shall appear to his satisfaction:
A. That the facts stated in any application for license filed by a licensee are false in any material
averment.
B. That the licensee has violated or failed to comply with any of the provisions of this chapter.
C. That the licensee permitted the operation of any motor vehicle licensed hereunder while such motor
vehicle was not in proper mechanical condition for safe and convenient operation, or while such
vehicle was not equipped and functioning as required by state statutes.
D. That the licensee permitted the operation of any motor vehicle licensed hereunder by any individual
prohibited by this chapter from engaging in such operation. (Ord. 2374, 8-22-2011)
4-10-12: PENALTY:
Any person violating or failing to comply with any provision of this chapter shall, upon conviction
thereof, be fined as provided in section 1-4-1 of this code. (Ord. 2374, 8-22-2011; amd. 2013 Code)
Chapter 11
CONTRACTORS
ARTICLE A. ELECTRICAL CONTRACTORS
4-11A-1: DEFINITION:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 126/460
The term "electrical contractor", as used in this article, means and is construed to include any person,
firm or corporation engaged in the business of installing or altering, by contract, equipment and
electrical appliances for the utilization of electricity supplied by light, heat or power, not including radio
apparatus or equipment for wireless reception of sounds and signals, and not including apparatus,
conductors and other equipment installed for or by public utilities, including common carriers, which
are under the jurisdiction of the Illinois commerce commission for use in their operation as public
utilities; but "electrical contractor" does not include employees employed by such contractor to do or
supervise such work. (1977 Code § 15.16.030)
4-11A-2: LICENSE REQUIRED; EXEMPTIONS:
A. No person shall hereafter engage in the business of electrical installation or wiring in the city
without having obtained an electrical contractor's license, as provided in this article. Provided, that
the provisions of this article shall not apply to work done by any public service corporation
furnishing and supplying an electrician upon its own lines, apparatus and equipment. (1977 Code
§ 15.16.050)
B. Any electrical contractor who is registered as such licensed contractor in any other city or village in
this state shall not be required to pay a fee for being licensed in this city; but every person, firm or
corporation doing business in the city as an electrical contractor shall secure a license. Such
license shall be issued without charge to electrical contractors licensed as such under the
ordinances of another city or village in this state. (1977 Code § 15.16.060)
4-11A-3: APPLICATION FOR LICENSE:
Every applicant desiring a license shall file with the city clerk a written application for such purpose
giving his name and place of business, and furnish any evidence required of him relative to the
responsibility, skill and ability of the applicant to carry on his business or trade under such license in
accordance with the ordinances, rules and regulations of the city. (1977 Code § 15.16.070; amd. 2013
Code)
4-11A-4: BOND REQUIREMENTS:
Every application for an electrical contractor license shall be accompanied by a bond of the applicant
with an approved surety company, to be approved by the city clerk, in the penal sum of three thousand
dollars ($3,000.00), conditioned that such license will protect and hold harmless the city against any
and all liability on account of any claims resulting from accident or damage occurring during the
execution of any wiring or work connected therewith, either by licensee or any person acting under his
direction; further conditioned upon said licensee conforming to all ordinances, conditions, and
requirements of the city relative to work to be done under such license; further conditioned upon the
proper restoration of streets, alleys, sidewalks, pavements, or subsurface improvements disturbed by
the licensee. (1977 Code § 15.16.080; amd. 2013 Code)
4-11A-5: LICENSE FEE:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 127/460
The annual fee for registering as an electrical contractor shall be twenty five dollars ($25.00);
provided, that for an application made after the expiration of the first six (6) months of the register
year, a certificate shall be issued upon the payment of one-half (1/2) the fee. The register year shall
correspond to the license year. (1977 Code § 15.16.090)
4-11A-6: EXAMINATION OF APPLICANT:
It shall be the duty of the code enforcement officer to examine all applicants desiring to engage in the
business of electrical installation or wiring in the city who shall file with the city clerk an application for
a license and pay the necessary fee therefor. (1977 Code § 15.16.040; amd. 2013 Code)
4-11A-7: ISSUANCE OF LICENSE:
A. Upon the recommendation of the code enforcement officer of the applicant for a license, and
payment of the fee and furnishing bond as aforesaid, the license shall be issued by the mayor and
countersigned by the city clerk. (1977 Code § 15.16.100; amd. 2013 Code)
B. When two (2) or more persons, copartners, or a corporation is an applicant for a license, the same
shall be issued in the name of the firm or copartnership. (1977 Code § 15.16.110)
4-11A-8: NONTRANSFERABILITY, EXPIRATION OF LICENSE:
No license shall be transferable, and every license shall expire on April 30 next succeeding its
issuance. (1977 Code § 15.16.120)
4-11A-9: CHANGE OF NAME OR LOCATION; POSTING LICENSE:
Any change of firm name or location of place of business shall be promptly reported to the city, and
every license shall be posted by the licensee in a conspicuous place in his place of business. (1977
Code § 15.16.130)
4-11A-10: PENALTY:
Any person who shall violate any provision of this chapter shall, upon conviction thereof, be subject to
a fine as provided in section 1-4-1 of this code. (2013 Code)
ARTICLE B. ROOFERS
4-11B-1: DEFINITION:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 128/460
When used in this article, the word "roofing" means to apply to any roof deck waterproofing materials
including all roofing, damp and waterproofing materials and/or systems such as shingles, tile, slate,
built up roofing, single ply and spray on roofing. (Ord. 1861, 8-5-2002)
4-11B-2: PERMIT REQUIREMENTS:
No individual, partnership or corporation shall engage in the city in roofing for compensation without
first obtaining a permit from the city clerk. Such permit shall not be issued until the submission of
satisfactory evidence that:
A. The applicant has in force public liability and property damage insurance in the amount of one
hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00).
B. The applicant has in force workers' compensation insurance covering the applicant's employees.
C. The applicant has submitted a bond in force in the amount of ten thousand dollars ($10,000.00) as
surety for satisfactory completion of any contracted undertaking. (2013 Code)
4-11B-3: STATE CERTIFICATION REQUIRED:
A. Any individual, partnership or corporation registering with the city clerk as required in section 4-11B-
2 of this article shall show proof of a valid current certificate issued pursuant to the provisions of
the Illinois roofing industry licensing act by the Illinois department of professional regulation.
B. No individual, partnership or corporation shall engage in roofing in the city without proof of
certification from the Illinois department of professional regulation and registering with the city clerk
as required in section 4-11B-2 of this article. (Ord. 1861, 8-5-2002)
4-11B-4: PENALTY:
Any violation of the provisions of this article shall subject the violator to a fine as provided in section 1-
4-1 of this code. Each day a violation is committed by a violator shall be a separate offense. (Ord.
1861, 8-5-2002; amd. 2013 Code)
ARTICLE C. TRASH HAULERS
4-11C-1: LICENSE REQUIRED; FEE:
A. Licensing Fee: Any person, corporation, or other legal entity that offers to remove trash from any
business or person within the city of Marion must pay an initial licensing fee of twenty five dollars
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.

($25.00) to the city clerk which shall be renewed annually. The licensing fee will be in effect as of
May 1, 2016.
B. License Required: No person, corporation or other legal entity may haul waste from any person or
business within the city of Marion without first obtaining a license to do so. (Ord. 3288, 2-22-2016)
4-11C-2: VEHICLE WEIGHTS:
A. All trash trucks over fifteen (15) tons' gross weight are prohibited from the cul-de-sacs on the
following streets, however the over fifteen (15) ton gross weight trucks are allowed to back up the

Abbey Lane

from a restricted street when necessary for the purpose of making pick ups or deliveries of goods,
wares and merchandise from any building or structure located on any restricted street, or for the
purpose of delivering materials to be used in the actual and bona fide repair, alteration, remodeling or
construction of any building, driveway, or structure upon such streets identified in section 4-11C-2 of
this article and for which a building permit has been previously obtained. (Ord. 3288, 2-22-2016)
4-11C-4: PENALTY:
Any person, business, or other legal entity who violates any provision of this article may subject the
violator to a fine not to exceed seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00). Each day a violation continues
shall be considered a separate offense. The failure to pay any imposed fine within fifteen (15) days of
its issuance will result in the forfeiture of any license to operate trash removal service in the city of
Marion. In the event that the city brings legal action to collect the fines, the costs of legal proceedings
including attorney fees shall be recoverable. (Ord. 3288, 2-22-2016)
