C. Backing Vehicles: The driver of a vehicle shall not back the same unless such movement can be
made with reasonable safety and without interference with other traffic. (1977 Code § 10.20.370)
D. Restricted Access Roadways: No person shall drive a vehicle onto or from any controlled access or
limited controlled access roadway except at such entrances and exits as are established by public
authority. (1977 Code § 10.20.380)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 229/460
7-3-16: PROCESSIONS:
A. Driving Through Processions: No driver of a vehicle shall drive between the vehicles comprising a
funeral or other authorized procession while they are in motion and when such vehicles are
conspicuously designated as required in this section. (1977 Code § 10.20.340)
B. Driving In Processions: Each driver in a funeral or other procession shall drive as near to the right
hand side of the roadway and shall follow the vehicle ahead as close as practical and safe. (1977
Code § 10.20.350)
C. Identification Of Funeral Processions: A funeral composed of a procession of vehicles shall be
identified as such by the display upon the outside of each vehicle of a pennant or other identifying
insignia and by having the lights of each vehicle lighted. (1977 Code § 10.20.360)
7-3-17: RIDING ON BICYCLES AND MOTORCYCLES:
A. Riding On Bicycles:
1. A person propelling a bicycle shall not ride other than upon or astride a permanent and regular
seat attached thereto.
2. No bicycle shall be used to carry more persons at one time than the number for which it is
designed and equipped; except, that an adult rider may carry a child securely attached to his
person in a backpack or sling.
B. Riding On Motorcycles:
1. A person operating a motorcycle shall ride only upon the permanent and regular seat attached
thereto, and such operator shall not carry any other person nor shall any other person ride on a
motorcycle unless such motorcycle is designed to carry more than one person, in which event, a
passenger may ride upon the permanent and regular seat if designed for two (2) persons, or
upon another seat firmly attached to the motorcycle at the rear or side of the operator.
2. A person shall ride upon a motorcycle only while sitting astride the seat, facing forward, with one
leg on each side of the motorcycle.
3. No person shall operate any motorcycle with handlebars higher than the height of the shoulders
of the operator when the operator is seated in the normal driving position astride that portion of
the seat or saddle occupied by the operator. (2013 Code)
7-3-18: MISCELLANEOUS PROHIBITIONS:
A. Clinging To Vehicles: It is unlawful for any person on any street riding a bicycle, motorcycle, or any
toy vehicle to cling to or attach himself or his vehicle to any moving motor vehicle. (1977 Code
§ 10.20.300; amd. 2013 Code)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 230/460
B. Toy Vehicles: It is unlawful for any person upon skates, a skateboard, a coaster, a sled or other toy
vehicle to go upon any roadway other than at a crosswalk. (1977 Code § 10.20.310; amd. 2013
Code)
C. Riding On Running Boards: It is unlawful for any person to ride upon the fenders, running board or
outside step of any vehicle. (1977 Code § 10.20.320)
7-3-19: RECKLESS, NEGLIGENT OR CARELESS DRIVING:
It is unlawful to operate any vehicle in the city in a careless, reckless, negligent or wanton manner, or
carelessly so as to endanger life or property. (1977 Code § 10.20.220)
7-3-20: DRIVING UNDER INFLUENCE OF INTOXICANTS:
A. A person shall not drive or be in actual physical control of any vehicle within the city while:
1. The alcohol concentration in the person's blood or breath is 0.08 or more based on the definition
of blood and breath units in 625 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/11-501.2;
2. Under the influence of alcohol;
3. Under the influence of any intoxicating compound or combination of intoxicating compounds to a
degree that renders the person incapable of driving safely;
4. Under the influence of any other drug or combination of drugs to a degree that renders the
person incapable of safely driving;
5. Under the combined influence of alcohol, other drug or drugs, or intoxicating compound or
compounds to a degree that renders the person incapable of safely driving; or
6. There is any amount of a drug, substance, or compound in the person's breath, blood, or urine
resulting from the unlawful use or consumption of cannabis listed in the cannabis control act1, a
controlled substance listed in the Illinois controlled substances act2, an intoxicating compound
listed in the use of intoxicating compounds act3, or methamphetamine as listed in the
methamphetamine control and community protection act4.
B. The fact that any person charged with violating this section is or has been legally entitled to use
alcohol, other drug or drugs, or intoxicating compound or compounds, or any combination thereof,
shall not constitute a defense against any charge of violating this section. (2013 Code)
Chapter 4
PARKING REGULATIONS
7-4-1: METHOD OF PARKING:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 231/460
A. Parallel Parking; Parking Within Stall: In parking motor vehicles or other vehicles upon any street in
the city, other than the public square, where marked parking stalls are lined off and designated by
authority of the commissioner of accounts, finances and streets, such vehicles shall be parked
within one of said marked parking stalls with the vehicle parked parallel to and adjoining the curb of
the street, and it is unlawful to park or leave standing any motor vehicle or other vehicle, when
unoccupied by a competent driver thereof, upon any of such streets in any other manner. (1977
Code § 10.28.050; amd. 2013 Code)
B. Parking On Right: When parking a motor vehicle upon any street or alley in the city, other than the
public square, said motor vehicle or any other vehicle shall be parked adjacent to and parallel with
the right hand curb or right hand edge of the traveled portion of said street or alley, and it is
unlawful to stop or park any motor vehicle or other vehicle, when said vehicle is unoccupied by a
competent driver thereof, in any other manner. "Right hand edge or curb" means the edge or curb
of a street or alley which is on the right hand side of the driver of a vehicle when such driver is
facing the same direction as the vehicle is facing. (1977 Code § 10.28.060)
C. Parking On Left; Angle Parking: No vehicle shall be parked with the left side of such vehicle next to
the curb except on one-way streets, and it shall be unlawful to stand or park any vehicle in a street
other than parallel with the curb and with the two (2) right wheels of the vehicle within twelve
inches (12") of the regularly established curb line; except, that upon those streets that have been
marked for angle parking, vehicles shall be parked at the angle to the curb indicated by such
marks. (1977 Code § 10.28.130)
D. Use Of More Than One Stall: It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation owning, controlling,
driving or operating any motor vehicle or other vehicle of any kind to cause or permit such vehicle
to be stopped or parked upon the public square, or upon any part of any street in the city, upon
which has been marked parking stalls by authority of the commissioner with jurisdiction over
streets, in such manner as to cover parts of more than one of such marked parking stalls. (1977
Code § 10.28.070; amd. 2013 Code)
7-4-2: STARTING PARKED VEHICLE:
No person shall start a vehicle which is stopped, standing, or parked unless and until such movement
can be made with reasonable safety. (1977 Code § 10.20.020)
7-4-3: UNATTENDED VEHICLE:
A. No vehicle shall be left unattended while the motor of such vehicle is running, and no vehicle shall
be left without a driver on any hill or incline unless the vehicle is secured against moving.
B. Whenever any police officer finds a vehicle unattended upon any bridge or causeway or in any
tunnel where such vehicle constitutes an obstruction to traffic, such officer is authorized to provide
for the removal of such vehicle to the nearest garage or other place of safety. (1977 Code
§ 10.20.280)
7-4-4: GENERAL PARKING RESTRICTIONS:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 232/460
A. Vehicles For Sale; Peddling Merchandise: It is unlawful to park any vehicle upon any street for the
purpose of displaying it for sale, or to park any vehicle upon any business street from which vehicle
merchandise is peddled. (1977 Code § 10.28.140)
B. Alleys: No person shall park a vehicle within any alley in such a manner or under such conditions
as to leave available less than ten feet (10') of the width of the roadway for the free movement of
vehicular traffic, and no person shall stop, stand, or park a vehicle within any alley in such a
position as to block the driveway entrance to any abutting property. (1977 Code § 10.28.160)
C. Private Property: It is unlawful to park any motor vehicle on any private property without the
consent of the owner of the property. (1977 Code § 10.28.180)
D. Inoperable Motor Vehicles: No inoperable motor vehicle, or a motor vehicle incapable of moving
under its own power, shall be parked or allowed to remain by its owner, operator or person
responsible therefor in or on a city street, alley, or public way for more than twenty four (24) hours.
The owner, operator or person responsible for parking or allowing a motor vehicle to remain in or
on a city street, alley or public way in violation of this subsection shall be fined, upon conviction of
such violation, an amount as provided in section 1-4-1 of this code. Each day such violation
continues is a separate offense. (Ord. 1154, 5-18-1987; amd. 2013 Code)
7-4-5: PARKING FOR PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES:
A. Authority To Designate Numbers And Locations:
1. The commissioner with jurisdiction over streets is hereby authorized to establish and designate
the amount and location of spaces upon public streets or public parking lots, and owners of
private property are authorized to establish and designate the amount and location of spaces
upon their private property, within the city, to be allowed for parking of vehicles which display:
(Ord. 1494, 1-10-1994; amd. 2013 Code)
a. A current disabled veteran's license plate.
b. A current state issued handicapped license plate.
c. A handicapped parking permit identification card issued by state or federal authorities. (Ord.
1494, 1-10-1994)
2. In designating handicapped parking spaces, the designated persons shall be guided by the
number of handicapped drivers anticipated to be using the parking lot or on street parking, the
needs of handicapped persons and the needs of the public.
3. The requirements of this subsection shall apply to existing parking lots as well as to new parking
lots to be constructed after the effective date hereof. Persons responsible for existing parking
lots shall have sixty (60) days from the date of notification to comply. Permits for a new parking
lot shall not be issued until handicapped parking spaces are provided as required by this
subsection.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 233/460
B. Unauthorized Parking: No person shall park any motor vehicle in a space designated for use for
handicapped parking upon a public street or a public or private parking lot unless such vehicle
shall have displayed thereon a current disabled veteran's license plate or handicapped parking
permit identification card. For the purposes of this subsection, a "space designated for
handicapped parking" shall mean any parking space located upon a public street or a public or
private parking lot which is marked and designated with a sign which is painted blue in color, with a
symbol of an individual in a wheelchair, painted in white in the middle of the blue area, or with such
symbol painted on the pavement. (Ord. 1493, 1-3-1994, eff. 1-17-1994)
C. Penalty: Any person, firm or corporation violating any provision of this section shall be fined not
more than two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) for each offense, and a separate offense shall be
deemed committed on each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues. (Ord. 1493, 1-
3-1994, eff. 1-17-1994; amd. 2013 Code)
7-4-6: SPECIFIC NO STANDING OR NO PARKING PLACES:
A. Except when necessary to avoid conflict with other traffic, or in compliance with law or the
directions of a police officer or official traffic control device, no person shall:
1. Stop, stand or park a vehicle:
a. On the roadway side of any vehicle stopped or parked at the edge or curb of a street.
b. On a sidewalk.
c. Within an intersection.
d. On a crosswalk.
e. Between a safety zone and the adjacent curb or within thirty feet (30') of points on the curb
immediately opposite the ends of a safety zone, unless a different length is indicated by signs
or markings.
f. Alongside or opposite any street excavation or obstruction when stopping, standing or parking
would obstruct traffic.
g. Upon any bridge or other elevated structure upon a highway or within a highway tunnel.
h. On any railroad tracks. A violation of any part of this subsection A1h shall result in a
mandatory fine of five hundred dollars ($500.00) or fifty (50) hours of community service.
i. At any place where official signs prohibit stopping.
j. On any controlled access highway.
k. In the area between roadways of a divided highway, including crossovers.
l. In a public parking area if the vehicle does not display a current annual registration sticker or
current temporary permit pending registration.
m. At any place where the standing of a vehicle will reduce the usable width of the roadway for
moving traffic to less than eighteen feet (18').
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 234/460
2. Stand or park a vehicle, whether occupied or not, except momentarily to pick up or discharge
passengers:
a. In front of a public or private driveway.
b. Within fifteen feet (15') of a fire hydrant.
c. Within twenty feet (20') of a crosswalk at an intersection.
d. Within thirty feet (30') upon the approach to any flashing signal, stop sign, yield sign, or traffic
control signal located at the side of a roadway.
e. Within twenty feet (20') of the driveway entrance to any fire station and on the side of a street
opposite the entrance to any fire station within seventy five feet (75') of such entrance (when
properly signposted).
f. At any place where official signs prohibit standing.
3. Park a vehicle, whether occupied or not, except temporarily for the purpose of and while actually
engaged in loading or unloading property or passengers:
a. Within fifty feet (50') of the nearest rail of a railroad crossing.
b. At any place where official signs prohibit parking.
B. No person shall move a vehicle not lawfully under his control into any such prohibited area or away
from a curb such distance as is unlawful. (2013 Code)
7-4-7: PARKING DURING STREET CLEANING:
It is unlawful to park any vehicle on any public street or portion thereof in the city at any time when
such street is being cleaned. Signs indicating that a street or portion thereof is being cleaned shall be
posted immediately before the cleaning of the street and shall be removed after the cleaning of the
street is finished. (1977 Code § 10.28.110)
7-4-8: TRUCK AND TRAILER PARKING:
A. Parking In Residential Areas:
1. Parking Restricted:
a. No motor vehicle licensed or titled as a "truck", rated as a "three-quarter ton truck" or higher,
may be parked in or on any city street, alley or public way in any area of the city bearing any
one of the city's residential zone classifications, except as hereinafter provided.
b. A motor vehicle licensed or titled as a "truck", rated as a "three-quarter ton truck" or higher,
used by a public utility, used in home delivery of goods or services, used in waste pick up, or
used in facilitating home repairs or maintenance may be parked upon a city street, alley or
public way in any area of the city bearing any one of the city's residential zone classifications
for the period of time reasonably required to complete such delivery, pick up, service, repair or
maintenance, as the case may be.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 235/460
2. Impoundment: The chief of police may cause to be removed from such city street, alley or public
way any such truck parked or allowed to remain thereon in violation of the provisions hereof. Any
cost incurred for the removal of any such truck shall be charged to the owner, operator or person
responsible for such truck. (Ord. 1154, 5-18-1987)
3. Penalty: The owner, operator or person responsible for parking or allowing a truck, as described
in this subsection, to remain in or on a city street, alley or public way in violation of this
subsection shall be fined, upon conviction of such violation, an amount as provided in section 1-
4-1 of this code. Each day such violation continues is a separate offense. (Ord. 1154, 5-18-1987;
amd. 2013 Code)
B. Parking After Dark: It is unlawful for any person to park a tractor or trailer or to leave a tractor or
trailer parked after dark on any street or alley of the city. (1977 Code § 10.28.030; amd. 2013
Code)
7-4-9: LOADING ZONES:
It is unlawful for the driver of a vehicle to stand a passenger vehicle for a period of time longer than is
necessary for the loading or unloading of passengers, not to exceed thirty (30) minutes, in any place
designated by the city council as a loading zone and marked as such, or in any of the following
designated places:
A. At any place, not to exceed seventy five feet (75'), along the curb before the entrance to any
hospital or hotel at any time. (1977 Code § 10.28.150)
B. At any place, not to exceed seventy five feet (75'), along the curb line before the entrance to a
public building between eight o'clock (8:00) A.M. and five o'clock (5:00) P.M. except on a Sunday.
(1977 Code § 10.28.150; amd. 2013 Code)
C. Directly in front of the entrance to any theater at any time that the theater is open. (1977 Code
§ 10.28.150)
7-4-10: SIGNS POSTED:
Appropriate signs shall be posted in all areas where parking is limited or prohibited, indicating such
limitations or prohibitions. (1977 Code § 10.28.190)
7-4-11: TOWING ILLEGALLY PARKED VEHICLES:
A. Authority To Tow: The police department and all members thereof are authorized to remove and
tow away, or have removed and towed away by commercial towing service, any car or other
vehicle illegally parked in any place where such parked vehicle creates or constitutes a traffic
hazard, blocks the use of a fire hydrant or obstructs or may obstruct the movement of any
emergency vehicle; or any vehicle which has been parked in any public street or other public place
for a period of twenty four (24) consecutive hours. (1977 Code § 10.28.120; amd. 2013 Code)
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 236/460
B. Storage And Redemption; Costs To Owner: Cars so towed away shall be stored on any city
property or in a public garage or parking lot and shall be restored to the owner or operator thereof
after payment of the expense incurred by the city in removing and storing such vehicles. (1977
Code § 10.28.120)
7-4-12: EMERGENCY VEHICLES EXEMPT:
Notwithstanding any of the provisions of this chapter, all emergency and rescue vehicles, when
answering emergency calls, are permitted to use and travel in any direction upon any of the streets
and alleys of the city. (1977 Code § 10.28.090; amd. 2013 Code)
ARTICLE A. OFF STREET PARKING LOTS
7-4A-1: LOTS DESIGNATED:
In order to relieve traffic confusion on the streets of the city and provide off street parking facilities for
motor vehicles in the city, the following improved parking lots are designated as lots on which the city
is authorized to mark off parking stalls:
A. Parking Lot No. 1: Parking lot no. 1 is located at the intersection of Madison and Union Streets in
block 11 of the original survey of Marion, Illinois, except that part occupied by the city hall.
B. Parking Lot No. 2: Parking lot no. 2 is located between Jefferson and Union Streets on lots 1 and 2
of block 10 of the second survey of the city of Marion, Illinois.
C. Parking Lot No. 3: Parking lot no. 3 is located between Jefferson and Union Streets on lots 1 and 2
of block 1 of the second survey of the city of Marion, Illinois.
D. Parking Lot No. 4: Parking lot no. 4 is located at the intersection of Madison and College Streets on
lots 1 and 2 of block 7 of the original survey of Marion, Illinois.
E. Parking Lot No. 5: Parking lot no. 5 is located on Union Street between North Van Buren and Print
Avenue.
F. Parking Lot No. 6: Parking lot no. 6 is located at the intersection of West Union Street and North
Van Buren north of the Methodist Church.
G. Parking Lot No. 7: Parking lot no. 7 is located on Print Avenue between West Jefferson Street and
West Johnson Street.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=972 237/460
H. Parking Lot No. 8: Parking lot no. 8 is located between East Jefferson Street and East Union Street
and North Market Street and North Madison Street.
I. Parking Lot No. 9: Parking lot no. 9 is located on the west side of North Liberty Street between West
Main Street and West Union Street. (1977 Code § 10.36.010; amd. 2013 Code)
7-4A-2: PERMITS TO PARK IN LOTS; FEE:
The city clerk is authorized to issue permits for parking motor vehicles in any vacant parking stalls
located upon the parking lots for a fee to be determined and a period of time to be agreed upon. (1977
Code § 10.36.060; amd. 2013 Code)
7-4A-3: LARGE TRUCKS PROHIBITED:
It is unlawful and a violation of this article for any person to drive into any one of the improved parking
lots described in section 7-4A-1 of this article a truck which has over a three-quarter ton rating. (1977
Code § 10.36.090)
ARTICLE B. PARKING RESTRICTIONS IN SPECIFIC
AREAS AND ON SPECIFIC STREETS
7-4B-1: PARKING IN OR NEAR PUBLIC SQUARE:
A. Method Of Parking: In parking motor vehicles or other vehicles on the public square, such vehicles
shall be placed in a parking stall, as marked off on the pavement by authority of the commissioner
with jurisdiction over streets. It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation owning, controlling,
driving or operating any such vehicle to cause or permit such vehicle, when unoccupied by a
competent driver thereof, to be stopped or parked on the public square in any other manner. (1977
Code § 10.28.040; amd. 2013 Code)
B. Truck Parking Prohibited: The parking of trucks having a capacity of more than three-quarter ton on
the public square at any time is prohibited. (1977 Code § 10.28.020; amd. 2013 Code)

unattended, on the parts of streets on the days and at the times designated as follows: (1977 Code
§ 10.32.040; amd. 2013 Code)

A. No More Than Ten Thousand Pounds:

South Market Street south to East Boyton Street.
That part of Williamson County Parkway which encircles the Illinois Center Mall.

1439, 5-11-1992; amd. 2013 Code)
B. Ten Thousand Pounds Or More:
1. Weight Limit Established: There are established truck routes through the city for any truck
whose destination is beyond the city, and which carries no cargo to be delivered at any point in
the city not on said routes, and whose gross weight, including truck and semitrailer or tractortrailer
and cargo, is ten thousand (10,000) pounds or more. (1977 Code § 10.16.010)

Court Street from Hendrickson Street to the north city limits; West Main Street from Court Street
to the west city limits; DeYoung Street from the west city limits to its intersection with North Fair
Street; and North Fair Street from DeYoung Street south to State Route 13. (1977 Code
§ 10.16.020)
